alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Harrison; Orange; Perry; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 21 at 3:46AM EST until December 23 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible Thursday night. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. Wind chills as low as 25 degrees below zero late Thursday night and Friday morning. * WHERE...Most of southern Indiana, and portions of central Kentucky generally west of Interstate 65 and along and north of the Western Kentucky Parkway. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in less than 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will plunge Thursday evening, leading to the possibility of a flash freeze. Strong wind gusts could make driving difficult...especially on north south roads. Blowing and drifting snow may reduce visibility and cause slick roads.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
